HTML.question: What is HTML?
HTML.hint: "Hypertext" refers to links that connect web pages to one another, either within a single website or between websites.

HTML.question: What is the difference between HTML elements and tags?
HTML.hint: What is an element? What is a tag? Where do they differ?
HTML.answer: First, an element is defined as a section of the web page that is used to communicate. A tag is text enclosed by angled brackets to describe text elements (<tagname>content</tagname>). The difference lies in how an element describes an object of the web page and the tag describes a quality of that object.

HTML.question: What are two types of web storage in HTML5?
HTML.answer: 1. Session Saving: This stores current session data and will be automatically deleted when the browser closes. 2. Local Storage: When the current storage window is closed, data is not automatically deleted.

HTML.question: What is a Semantic Element?
HTML.hint: What does it mean to be semantic?
HTML.answer: An element that expresses its meaning for the web browser and developer, (e.g. Header, Footer)

Javascript.question: Is it possible to break JavaScript Code into several lines?
Javascript.answer: Breaking within a string statement can be done by the use of a backslash at the end of the first line

Javascript.question: Which company developed JavaScript?
Javascript.answer: Netscape is the software company who developed JavaScript.

CSS.question: How can you integrate CSS on a web page?
CSS.answer: Inline method - It is used to insert style sheets in HTML document, Embedded/Internal method - It is used to add a unique style to a single document Linked/Imported/External method - It is used when you want to make changes on multiple pages.

CSS.question: What are the CSS frameworks?
CSS.answer: Bootstrap, Foundation, Semantic UI, Gumby, Ulkit
